meanings.definition: To surgically remove a part of an organ or tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will resect the tumor from the patient's lung.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will resect the damaged tissue during the operation.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I could resect the burnt part of the toast to make it edible.
meanings.sent4: She decided to resect the negativity from her life like a skilled surgeon.
meanings.sent5: The image of the surgeon delicately resecting the tumor stayed with me.

meanings.definition: To cut out or excise a portion of something.
meanings.sent1: The chef had to resect the spoiled section of the fruit before using it.
meanings.sent2: It was necessary to resect the damaged wire from the circuit to fix it.
meanings.sent3: I had to resect the incorrect paragraph from my essay to improve it.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to resect the toxic relationship from her life.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully resected the dead branches to help the tree thrive.
